definition: to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: He himself is a perennial Nobel also-ran.
sentences.chinese: 他自己就長年是諾貝爾和平獎落選者。

sentences.english: They qualified for the qualifying tourney by their finish in last year's regional tournaments.
sentences.chinese: 他們通過去年的地區選拔賽獲得了落選錦標賽的資格。

sentences.english: Chen Zhonghe, mostly favored, was elected out unexpectedly and lost the election for another term.
sentences.chinese: 呼聲最高的陳忠和意外落選，失去了連任的機會。

sentences.english: People can argue about why Mayor Fenty lost after one term.
sentences.chinese: 人們對芬蒂在一屆任期後便落選可能會有所爭議。

sentences.english: She ran as a pro-choice Republican and lost narrowly.
sentences.chinese: 她以親共和黨的身份參選，以微弱差距落選。

sentences.english: Jermaine Pennant has revealed his disappointment after being overlooked for England once again.
sentences.chinese: 再次落選英格蘭隊，彭南特難以掩飾失望之情。

sentences.english: I bet her ￡200 that she would lose the vote.
sentences.chinese: 我拿200英鎊和她打賭，說她在選舉中肯定落選。

sentences.english: The Company will dispose personal data of all unsuccessful applicants.
sentences.chinese: 所有落選者之個人資料將被本公司棄除。

sentences.english: At the second year's examination, he was not classed at all.
sentences.chinese: 他在第二年的考試中落選了，不能被編班。

sentences.english: More than half will end up losers on election night.
sentences.chinese: 而超過一半將會在競選之夜落選。

sentences.english: Troops to school recruiting, fine sister, lily but was rejected.
sentences.chinese: 部隊來學校招兵，細妹入選，莉莉卻落選。

sentences.english: He has already lost two general elections and his party, unsurprisingly, seethes with barely contained rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 他已經兩度落選，人民黨也無疑叛念中燒。

definition: to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
widely spread/widely rumored/stories abound/(sb's exploits are) widely circulated
(sports) member of the national team/national representative/(medicine, chess etc) one of the most highly skilled practitioners in one's country
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to ask sb to resign from a post
